title: AI can be more persuasive than real doctors, even when it's wrong

content:

title: Artificial intelligence has promises and risks for patients
description: Beyond the White Coat: Dr. Jason Kolb says physicians and patients already are finding artificial intelligence useful. But what are the risks?
content:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is coming to a doctor’s office near you. In fact, it probably is already there.

title: AI is watching us. We need city officials watching AI.
description: Artificial intelligence in Philly government is a black box: There is no public process for communities to review proposed tech and determine if it’s truly safe for us — let alone beneficial.
content: By now, you’ve noticed: Artificial intelligence is everywhere. Doorbell cameras film us walking through our neighborhood, Gmail insists on auto-generating email replies, and we’re told to accept a face scan to board an airplane. Health insurance CEOs... [4551 chars]

title: AI can't answer the most important questions in life
description: Artificial intelligence answers a lot of our questions, but not the ones that may matter most.
content: It’s a really good question, and one that only we humans can answer thoroughly. To pose a question to a large language model like ChatGPT is to witness a breathtaking feat of synthesis. Ask for the primary causes of the Thirty Years’ War or a summary... [7180 chars]

title: Is artificial intelligence fading human memory?
description: Voice assistants remind us of birthdays; apps keep medical records organised. The conveniences of artificial intelligence make life easier but also raise a deeper concern
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is no longer futuristic; it is part of how we live today. We rely on voice assistants to remind us of birthdays, apps to keep our medical records organised, and digital tools to suggest when it might be time for a check-u... [2771 chars]

title: How is AI reshaping classrooms without replacing teachers?
description: Artificial intelligence is rapidly transforming education, enabling personalised learning and bridging gaps in access and quality. Yet, the true challenge lies in using AI to enhance, not replace, the human element of teaching and learning.
content:
For decades, education has struggled with a core challenge – how to address individual learning needs at scale!
The way we approach education is being fundamentally redefined. The age-old, one-size-fits-all approach is giving way to a more tailored, ... [5573 chars]

title: A mystery CEO and billions in sales: Is China buying banned Nvidia chips?
